OCTEON SDK examples overview

A variety of examples are provided with the OCTEON SDK.

For further information on these examples please refer to the README.txt and source code for the example.

  • hello: Classic example showing a simple program. README.txt
  • crypto: Example showing how to use the cryptographic functions of each cnMIPS core. README.txt
  • application-args: Example showing how to pass arguments to applications and also how to run multiple applications on multiple sets of cores. README.txt
  • passthrough: This example demonstrates simple packet input/output by sending all received packets out the same port they came in on. README.txt
  • mailbox: Example showing inter-core messaging using the mailbox interrupts. README.txt
  • queue: This example shows a memory access efficient queue implementation. README.txt
  • debugger: Example showing how to use the simple executive debugger. README.txt
  • uart: Example showing how to do serial IO using polling or interrupts. README.txt
  • low-latency-mem: Example showing how to access low latency memory (RLDRAM.) README.txt
  • zip: Example showing the use of the zip compression/decompression hardware. README.txt
  • traffic-gen: Example showing the use of OCTEON as a traffic generator. README.txt
  • named-block: Example showing the use cvmx_bootmem named block allocations. README.txt
  • linux-filter: Example showing how to pass packets between cores running linux and a simple executive application. README.txt
  • pcie-scan: Example shows how to enumerates all host mode PCIe ports, and looks for all PCI/PCIe devices, include devices over bridge. README.txt
  • hotplug-app: Example shows how to use cvmx_app_hotplug APIs for registering an application for hotplug. README.txt
  • power-throttle: Example shows how to use cvmx_power_throttle APIs for using the OCTEON II Power Throttling feature. README.txt
  • adma: Example demonstrating how to transfer data between OCTEON memory and Endor PHY in evb71xx OCTEON model using AXI DMA APIs. README.txt
  • coredump: Example demonstrating a coredump machanizm for simple-executive applications.
  • otrace: Example demonstrating how to use otrace feature.
  • lmc-dump: Example displays all the valid LMC CSRs for the OCTEON model the application is invoked on.
Generated on 27 Oct 2017 for Octeon Software Development Kit by  1.6.1
